newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil warehouse workers go on strike at Santos.
newsitem.headline: Brazil warehouse workers go on strike at Santos.

text.p: Warehouse workers at Brazil's key port of Santos have decided to start a strike today over a dispute about backpay, a spokeswoman for the port said.
"They have decided to go ahead with a strike," she said.
The stoppage will affect imports but not exports, she said.
Officials at the Administrative Portworkers Union said over the weekend the stoppage would bring 90 percent of all import activity and 70 percent of export activity at the port to a halt.
Port officials on Monday said they were still assessing the extent of the strike.
The officials also said they do not know how long the strike will last.
Previous strikes at the port have affected shipment of commodities such as sugar, soybeans, wheat and orange juice.
